content:
I am a 2nd year graduate student in Computer Science at UMass Amherst where I am advised by Prof. Cameron Musco. I completed undergraduate from IIIT Hyderabad in August 2016. I am interested in theoretical foundations of machine learning.
I spent the summer of 2020 as an Applied Science intern at Amazon Alexa NLU in the Internationalization team where I was advised by Dr. Abdalghani Abujabal. Prior to this I worked for 2 years at the Surveillance Analytics Group at Goldman Sachs in the search engine ranking team led by Dr. Mayur Thakur.
News  Awarded Grace Hopper Scholarship 2020   I will be presenting my recent research at the Data Science Symposium at UMass. 	 Research  My current research is in random projection methods for embedding high dimensional subspaces that undergo nonlinear transformations.  Subspace Embeddings Under Nonlinear Transformations
Aarshvi Gajjar and Cameron Musco
In Submission.
  Projects  Sep 2020 - Dec 2020 : Grading Assistant, COMPSCI 689 Machine Learning, UMass Amherst   Jan 2016 - May 2016 : Teaching Assistant, Science II, IIIT Hyderabad   Sep 2015 - Dec 2015 : Teaching Assistant, Signals and Systems, IIIT Hyderabad   Teaching Experience  Sep 2020 - Dec 2020 : Grading Assistant, COMPSCI 689 Machine Learning, UMass Amherst   Jan 2016 - May 2016 : Teaching Assistant, Science II, IIIT Hyderabad   Sep 2015 - Dec 2015 : Teaching Assistant, Signals and Systems, IIIT Hyderabad   Experiences  Jun 2020 - Aug 2020 : Applied Science Intern, Amazon Alexa   Dec 2018 - Jun 2019 : Senior Strats Analyst (Senior SDE), Surveillance Analytics Group, Goldman Sachs   Aug 2017 - Dec 2017 : Strats Analyst (SDE), Surveillance Analytics Group, Goldman Sachs   Aug 2017 - Dec 2017 : Strats Analyst, Surveillance Analytics Group, Goldman Sachs   Aug 2016 - Dec 2016 : SDE, Next Generation Pricing, WalmartLabs

title: Aarshvi Gajjar
